content.question: "Aeole (namque tibi divum pater atque hominum rex et mulcere dedit fluctus et tollere vento), gens inimica mihi Tyrrhenum navigat aequor Ilium in Italiam portans victosque penates: 5incute vim ventis submersasque obrue puppes, aut age diversos et disice corpora ponto. Sunt mihi bis septem praestanti corpore Nymphae, quarum quae forma pulcherrima Deiopea, conubio iungam stabili propriamque dicabo." Aeneid 1. 65-73 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. In lines 1-4 (Aeole . . . penates), which three Latin words can be translated “granted the power to raise the waves”? 2. What are the case and use of aequor (line 3) ? 3. In the passage, which three Latin words indicate that the Trojans are a group of people whom Juno dislikes? 4. As described in Book 2, explain how the victos penates (line 4) escaped from Troy. Answer in 1-2 complete sentences. 5. In lines 3-6 (gens . . . ponto), which two Latin words command that the Trojans be separated from each other? 6. (A) Identify the case and number of quae (line 8). (B) To whom or what does it refer? 7. (A) Which two Latin words are connected by the conjunction -que (line 9) ? (B) Translate them in context. 8. (A) Identify one and only one literary device found in line 9 (conubio . . . dicabo) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it. 9. (A) Identify three ablative nouns in this passage and (B) translate them in context.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
